introduction.para: This document details the procedure for installing a bicycle stem. It outlines preliminary requirements, the main procedure, and closing requirements.

section.title: 1. Introduction
section.para: This document details the procedure for installing a bicycle stem. It outlines preliminary requirements, the main procedure, and closing requirements.

subsection.title: 2.4. Safety Precautions
subsection.caution: Do not overtighten the stem bolt. Overtightening can damage the headset bearings.
The stem bolt does not secure the stem.
subsection.note: Ensure the stem is aligned forward in line with the wheel.

subsection.title: 2.5. Prerequisites
subsection.para: Ensure the bicycle is securely mounted on a work stand with the front wheel free of the ground.

step.title: 3.1. Step: Cleaning
step.para: Remove all rust and corrosion using a clean dry cloth and rubbing alcohol.

item.title: 3.2.1. Item: Lubrication
item.para: Apply general lubricant to the following:

itemList.item: The threads of the stem and stem bolt.

item.title: 3.2.2. Item: Installation
item.para: Install the stem into the steerer tube.

image.imageCaption: (Image placeholder – See original document for actual image)

item.title: 3.2.3. Item: Alignment & Tightening
item.para: Adjust the stem to align with the wheel. Firmly tighten the stem bolt.

step.title: 3.3. Step: Handlebar Installation
step.para: Install the handlebars (refer to document: S1000DBIKEAAA DA220000AA720A).

closingRequirements.para: No specific closing requirements are listed.
